abstract.p: Russel E Higgins letter lauds Jim Holt's July 2 Bookend essay on George Grossmith's Diary of a Nobody (S)

block.p: Three cheers for Jim Holt for his wonderfully evocative Bookend essay on George Grossmith's ''Diary of a Nobody'' (''I Yield to Nobody,'' July 2). I, too, was shocked to see Grossmith as a backstage Victorian drug addict in the movie ''Topsy-Turvy,'' for I instantly recognized the name as that of the author of one of my favorite novels, a novel I read every year. Holt is to be commended for bringing this brilliant satire to the attention of Times readers and doing such excellent research for us Grossmith lovers.
